question: A lot of people believe that the amount of violence shown on TV and in the cinema affects the actions of our young people and therefore increases the amount of violence in our society today. Do you agree or disagree with this statement? What can be done to reduce violence in our society today?
text: It is widely believed that the telecasting of crime scenes in movie theatres and the television screens has played an incredible role in spoiling the activities of youngsters; while it has, risen the unlawful action in local areas. Therefore according to my opinion, there should be restrictions on certain films prior to launch and the warning policy for criminals.

To begin with, the fact that we cannot escape from watching television or visiting in cinemas is a significant cause of complaint. Similarly, the violation or Fight is owing to melodrama whenever we watch on screens is interesting and catches our attention. For example, the Twilight film, although it teaches a lesson of humanism, however the methods of crime for money or love develop an idea in youth’s mind; thus, a person implements the same in the society. Consequently, the presences of the unlawful films spoil the younger’s thinking and lead to act practically.

Nevertheless, the restriction to producing an unlawful film and early warning to the youngsters can support in crime reduction. All the movies ought to be monitored before finalizing, uploading or launching on any platform. Furthermore, there must be a fine or a ban on relevant media producer in case of misconduct. Moreover, the authorities must warn the public through electronic media not to involve in any sort of illegal activity likewise, thief, stealing any stuff and disclose severe of possible punishment such as thief, stealing any stuff. Hence, the controlling of different publishing movies, and the relevant policy for punishment for the youth might reduce the scandal rate.
